description.lang: A Z-Wave security enabled entry control device. You can arm/disarm your house to home or away with the Tag Reader 500. With the use of a RFID tag or a numerical code the device can send an entry control message which can be handled by a supported gateway. In addition the Tag Reader supports the activation of scenes.
Set all configuration values to default values (factory settings).Read more in chapter Configuration Reset.All values except for 0x55 and 0xAA will default the other configurations values
To configure the time the beep is automatically turned off in seconds.Value 0x00 means disable.Valuebetween 0x01 and 0xFE is the time in secondsValue 0xFF means endless.

To configure the timeout to wait for a WAKEUP_NO_MORE_INFORMATION before the error beep is automatically sound.The error beeps are fixed 8 beeps shortly after each other.Value 0x00 means disable.Valuebetween 0x01 and 0xFF is the time in seconds
To configure the number of beeps per second. Every beep is fixed about 10ms.Value between 0x00 and 0xFF are number of beeps per second
To configure the always awake mode.Value 3: set to always awake modeValue any other then 3: set to normal operation mode

The mode that the TagReader communicates with the associated gateway. Value 0x00: The RFID and Numeric codes are reported in gateway modeValue 0x010xFF: the RFID and Numeric codes are reported in local mode

In gateway mode it is possible to let the gateway decide if the Tag Reader can arm to home or away. If gateway indication is disabled the Tag Reader automatically assumes that it can arm and will wait for a user input of RFID TAG or numeric code. Value 0x00: Gatewayconfirmation disabledValue 0x010xFF: Gatewayconfirmation enabled
